author: Business Today Desk
title: Mahindra to hike SUV and CV prices by up to 3% from April, joins rivals as input costs surge
description: Mahindra reported total auto sales of 83,702 vehicles last month, marking a 15 percent increase year-on-year, including exports.
content: Starting April, Mahindra & Mahindra will hike prices of its SUVs and commercial vehicles by up to 3 percent. The company said it had absorbed most of the rising input costs but was now compelled … [+1572 chars]

author: Sharmistha Mukherjee
title: Auto sales hit record highs for third year despite slowing growth, SIAM data shows
description: Indian auto sales saw modest growth in fiscal year 2024-25, with passenger vehicle sales up 2% driven by utility vehicles. Two-wheeler sales surged by 9.1% due to rural demand, while three-wheelers also rose. Commercial vehicles experienced a slight decline. …
content: Car sales in the local market grew in low single-digits in the fiscal that ended on 31 March. Compared to last year, on a high base and amid slowing demand in the local market.As per data released by… [+4844 chars]

author: Ayaan Kartik
title: Car dealers struggle as demand slows, inventory piles up
description: Automakers offer discounts as inventory surges from about a week at the start of the year to up to 55 days in March as demand slows
